meanings.sent1: She prologuized the play by explaining the background of the story.
meanings.sent2: The actor prologuized the performance by setting the scene for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat prologuized its entrance into the room with a loud meow.
meanings.sent4: His smile prologuized his friendly nature to everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The sun prologuized the start of a new day with its warm rays.

meanings.definition: To introduce or preface something with a prologue.
meanings.sent1: The author prologuized the novel with a brief summary of what was to come.
meanings.sent2: She prologuized her speech with a personal anecdote to engage the audience.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prologuized its nut-gathering mission with a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The painting prologuized the artist's emotions through vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prologuized the lesson with an interesting historical fact.
